main.java

Class WeatherAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.WeatherAPI

  • public class WeatherAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that performs a call on the Open Weather Map API and fetches the JSONObject.
    Since:
    February 24, 2015
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jeremy Alcorta

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WeatherAPI(int cityID, boolean viewMetric)
      Creates a WeatherAPI object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static org.json.JSONObject getLikeCities(java.lang.String cityName)
      Returns a JSONObject from a API call using a "like" search in OpenWeatherMap of a provided city.
      org.json.JSONObject getLocal()
      Returns a JSONObject from a API call for current weather of a provided city.
      org.json.JSONObject getLongTerm()
      Returns a JSONObject from a API call for the long-term forecast of a provided city.
      org.json.JSONObject getShortTerm()
      Returns a JSONObject from an API call for the short-term forecast of a provided city.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WeatherAPI

        public WeatherAPI(int cityID,
          boolean viewMetric)
        Creates a WeatherAPI object. Sets the city ID and units to be used (metric or imperial).
        Parameters:
        cityID - the city id for the query
        viewMetric - true if metric units are being used, false if imperial units are used

    • Method Detail

      • getShortTerm

        public org.json.JSONObject getShortTerm()
                                 throws org.json.JSONException,
                                        java.io.IOException
        Returns a JSONObject from an API call for the short-term forecast of a provided city. Returns null if invalid call made. The JSONObject contains weather data in 3 hour increments for the next 24 hours.
        Returns:
        the JSONObject for short-term forecast of a provided city
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if an error occurred with the fetched JSONObject
        java.io.IOException - if an input or output exception occurred (i.e. could not reach server)

      • getLongTerm

        public org.json.JSONObject getLongTerm()
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       org.json.JSONException
        Returns a JSONObject from a API call for the long-term forecast of a provided city. The JSONObject contains daily weather data for the following 5 days.
        Returns:
        the JSONObject for long-term forecast of a provided city
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if an error occurred with the fetched JSONObject
        java.io.IOException - if an input or output exception occurred (i.e. could not reach server)

      • getLocal

        public org.json.JSONObject getLocal()
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    org.json.JSONException
        Returns a JSONObject from a API call for current weather of a provided city. The JSONObject contains current weather data.
        Returns:
        the JSONObject for current weather of a provided city
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if an error occurred with the fetched JSONObject
        java.io.IOException - if an input or output exception occurred (i.e. could not reach server)

      • getLikeCities

        public static org.json.JSONObject getLikeCities(java.lang.String cityName)
                                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                                LocationNotFoundException,
                                                org.json.JSONException
        Returns a JSONObject from a API call using a "like" search in OpenWeatherMap of a provided city. The JSONObject contains the like search data.
        Parameters:
        String - desired city name to search
        Returns:
        the JSONObject for current weather of a provided city
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if an error occurred with the fetched JSONObject
        java.io.IOException - if an input or output exception occurred (i.e. could not reach server)
        LocationNotFoundException - if there are no matches for the like search
